episodeTitle: Disembarking with Sights Set on Fish-man Island - The Sabaody Archipelago
description: The Straw Hats enjoy takoyaki prepared by Hatchan as they sail toward the Sabaody Archipelago. Duval returns with a transformed handsome face, rebranding his crew as the Rosy Life Riders. Upon arrival at Sabaody, the crew marvels at the bubble-covered archipelago and receives a crucial warning from Hatchan about the World Nobles.

openingSong.title: We Are! (Animation One Piece 10th Anniversary Ver.)

events.title: Hatchan's Takoyaki Feast
events.description: After defeating the Flying Fish Riders, Hatchan prepares takoyaki for the entire Straw Hat crew. The crew enjoys the meal together, with even Sanji being impressed by the flavor. Luffy, Usopp, and Chopper eat until they can't move, while Hatchan collapses from exhaustion trying to keep up with their servings.
events.significance: A celebratory moment that transitions from the Flying Fish Riders arc to the Sabaody Archipelago arc. It shows the crew's bond with their new friends and provides a brief respite before the serious events to come.

events.title: Duval's Handsome Transformation Revealed
events.description: Duval returns to the Straw Hats, but instead of seeking revenge, he thanks Sanji. His face has been completely transformed from ugly to handsome due to Sanji's kicks in their previous battle. He no longer resembles Sanji's wanted poster.
events.significance: This humorous transformation turns a former enemy into an ally. Duval's gratitude and his crew's rebranding marks the resolution of the Flying Fish Riders conflict and sets up future assistance for the Straw Hats.

quotes.text: Sanji! I came to thank you! Your kicks gave me this handsome face!
quotes.speaker: Duval
quotes.context: Duval expressing his gratitude to Sanji for inadvertently fixing his face

events.title: Flying Fish Riders Rebranded as Rosy Life Riders
events.description: Duval announces that his crew has been renamed from the 'Flying Fish Riders' to the 'Rosy Life Riders' to reflect their new positive outlook on life. He gives the Straw Hats his Den Den Mushi number so they can call for help if needed.
events.significance: Establishes the Rosy Life Riders as potential allies for the Straw Hats. This gesture of friendship will prove crucial during the later events at Sabaody Archipelago.

quotes.text: From now on, we're the Rosy Life Riders! If you ever need help, just call us!
quotes.speaker: Duval
quotes.context: Duval offering his crew's assistance to the Straw Hats

events.title: Explanation of Fish-Man Island Route
events.description: Hatchan and Pappag explain to the Straw Hats how to reach Fish-Man Island. Ships must be coated with special bubble resin at Sabaody Archipelago to travel underwater through the depths beneath the Red Line. This is the only way for pirates to reach the New World without going through Mary Geoise.
events.significance: Critical world-building information that establishes the necessity of visiting Sabaody Archipelago and introduces the concept of ship coating. This information drives the plot for the entire arc.

quotes.text: To reach Fish-Man Island, you need to coat your ship with special resin bubbles at Sabaody. It's the only way to dive 10,000 meters underwater!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Explaining the necessity of ship coating to reach Fish-Man Island

events.title: First Sight of Sabaody Archipelago
events.description: The Thousand Sunny arrives at Sabaody Archipelago (Grove 41). The crew is amazed by the sight of the unique island made of massive mangrove trees with bubbles floating everywhere. The archipelago's distinctive bubble-covered landscape captures everyone's attention.
events.significance: The crew's arrival at Sabaody Archipelago marks the beginning of one of the most pivotal arcs in One Piece. This location will be the site of major character introductions, world-building revelations, and devastating events.

quotes.text: Wow! Look at all those bubbles! This place is amazing!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first reaction to seeing Sabaody Archipelago

events.title: Explanation of Sabaody's Bubbles
events.description: Hatchan explains that the bubbles at Sabaody Archipelago are produced by the respiration of the massive Yarukiman Mangrove trees. The bubbles are unique to this area and won't work anywhere else. Luffy excitedly jumps onto the bubbles, but they pop and he falls to the ground.
events.significance: Provides world-building details about Sabaody's unique ecosystem. The bubbles become a visual and thematic element throughout the arc, and the bubble coating will be essential for the crew's journey.

quotes.text: These bubbles come from the mangrove trees' roots. They only exist here at Sabaody!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Explaining the origin of Sabaody's unique bubbles

events.title: Hatchan's Warning About the World Nobles
events.description: Before the crew disembarks, Hatchan gives them a stern warning about the World Nobles (Celestial Dragons) who live at Sabaody. He tells them that no matter what happens - even if someone is killed right before their eyes - they must never interfere with or defy a World Noble, as it would bring an Admiral down upon them.
events.significance: This warning is one of the most important pieces of foreshadowing in the series. It sets up the tension for the entire Sabaody arc and directly leads to one of the most consequential moments in One Piece when Luffy punches a Celestial Dragon in a later episode.

quotes.text: Listen carefully! No matter what the World Nobles do, even if someone is killed right in front of you, you must never raise your hand against them! If you do, a Marine Admiral will come!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Hatchan's crucial warning to the Straw Hats about the Celestial Dragons

events.title: Preparation to Explore Sabaody
events.description: After receiving Hatchan's warning, the Straw Hats prepare to disembark and explore Sabaody Archipelago. They discuss finding a coating mechanic and splitting up to explore the island while searching for someone who can coat the Thousand Sunny.
events.significance: Sets up the narrative structure for the Sabaody arc, where the crew will split into groups and have various encounters across the archipelago.

quotes.text: Sanji! I came to thank you! Your kicks gave me this handsome face!
quotes.speaker: Duval
quotes.context: Duval expressing his gratitude to Sanji

quotes.text: To reach Fish-Man Island, you need to coat your ship with special resin bubbles at Sabaody. It's the only way to dive 10,000 meters underwater!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan

quotes.text: Wow! Look at all those bubbles! This place is amazing!
quotes.speaker: Luffy

quotes.text: Listen carefully! No matter what the World Nobles do, even if someone is killed right in front of you, you must never raise your hand against them! If you do, a Marine Admiral will come!
quotes.speaker: Hatchan

quotes.text: From now on, we're the Rosy Life Riders! If you ever need help, just call us!
quotes.speaker: Duval
quotes.context: Rebranding his crew and offering assistance

themes.description: The episode marks a major transition point as the crew moves from the relatively lighthearted Flying Fish Riders arc to the serious and consequential Sabaody Archipelago arc. Duval's transformation and rebranding symbolizes new beginnings.
themes.symbolism: The bubbles of Sabaody represent the fragile and temporary nature of the crew's current peace, foreshadowing the arc's devastating conclusion.

themes.description: Hatchan's dire warning about the World Nobles creates an atmosphere of tension and danger. The specific instruction to not intervene 'even if someone is killed' plants a seed for future conflict.
themes.symbolism: The World Nobles represent the absolute authority and inequality in the One Piece world, and the warning sets up the arc's exploration of these themes.

themes.description: Duval's transformation from enemy to ally demonstrates the series' recurring theme of bonds formed through conflict. His offer to help the Straw Hats shows genuine gratitude and friendship.
themes.symbolism: The takoyaki feast represents camaraderie and the sharing of food as a bonding ritual common in Japanese culture.
culturalReferences: Takoyaki as a communal food in Japanese culture

characterSpotlights.development: Hatchan takes on a protective role, warning the Straw Hats about the dangers of Sabaody and explaining how to reach Fish-Man Island. His serious demeanor when discussing the World Nobles shows his understanding of the dangers ahead.
keyActions: Prepares takoyaki feast for the crew
Explains ship coating and route to Fish-Man Island
Gives crucial warning about World Nobles
Guides the crew to Sabaody Archipelago
quotes: Listen carefully! No matter what the World Nobles do, even if someone is killed right in front of you, you must never raise your hand against them!

characterSpotlights.development: Duval's complete transformation from antagonist to ally is completed. His gratitude to Sanji and rebranding of his crew shows character growth and sets up future assistance.
keyActions: Returns to thank Sanji for his new handsome face
Renames his crew to Rosy Life Riders
Gives the Straw Hats his Den Den Mushi number
quotes: Sanji! I came to thank you! Your kicks gave me this handsome face!
From now on, we're the Rosy Life Riders! If you ever need help, just call us!

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his typical excited and carefree attitude when arriving at new locations. His playful jumping on bubbles contrasts with the serious warning he receives, highlighting his tendency to underestimate danger.
keyActions: Excitedly explores the bubbles at Sabaody
quotes: Wow! Look at all those bubbles! This place is amazing!

mangaDifferences.difference: Brook's scene after eating takoyaki is extended in the anime. He farts first, then burps, before being punched by Nami. In the manga (Chapter 496), this happens in just one frame.
When Brook is punched by Nami, he flies to the left in the anime, while he stands still in the manga.
The anime extends the arrival sequence at Sabaody with more shots of the bubbles and the crew's reactions compared to the manga's more concise presentation.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 496 (pages 2-19), titled 'Yarukiman Mangrove', which is the name of the trees that produce Sabaody's bubbles.
The opening theme for this episode is the Tohoshinki (TVXQ) remix of 'We Are!', created to commemorate the One Piece anime's 10th anniversary. It was used from episodes 373 to 394.

sources.title: We Are!/Tohoshinki (2008) Remix - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Episode 390 had a TV rating of 8.7% and ranked 7th in its timeslot when it aired in Japan on February 22, 2009.
The eyecatcher for this episode features Nami and Luffy, highlighting two of the main characters as they enter the Sabaody Archipelago arc.
Duval is voiced by Kazuki Yao in Japanese, who also voices Franky. This creates a humorous dynamic in the scenes where both characters appear together.

Sabaody Archipelago's grove numbering system is introduced in this episode. Grove 41 is where the Thousand Sunny docks. The archipelago has 79 groves total, each numbered and with different functions.
Hatchan's warning about World Nobles is one of the most significant pieces of foreshadowing in the series, as it directly sets up the events that will occur six episodes later in Episode 396.
